definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Through bad operation, the company had a slump in profits.
sentences.chinese: 由於經營不善，公司利潤驟降。

sentences.english: The temperature dived to ten below zero.
sentences.chinese: 溫度驟降到了零下十度。

sentences.english: Similarly, the savings rate plummeted to zero.
sentences.chinese: 同時，儲蓄率驟降至幾乎歸零。

sentences.english: Although sunshine in the day is still hot, after sunset, temperatures decrease rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 儘管白天陽光很足，日落之後，氣溫驟降。

sentences.english: Once standards were established, the number of these fatalities plummeted.
sentences.chinese: 水質標準被建立起來後，死亡人數驟降。

sentences.english: The thermometer takes a nose dive the first day of winter.
sentences.chinese: 入冬第一天氣溫計的水銀柱驟降。

sentences.english: The local shares index has dropped sharply towards the 3000 mark.
sentences.chinese: 本地股指驟降，直逼3000點大關。

sentences.english: If they lose, their testosterone levels will plummet.
sentences.chinese: 如果輸了，睾丸酮水平就會驟降。

sentences.english: The main re a son for the rapid air temperature decrease was the intense cold advection.
sentences.chinese: 強盛的冷平流是造成氣溫驟降的主要原因。

sentences.english: My plane swooped from 20,000 metres to 500 metres.
sentences.chinese: 我駕機從二萬米高空一下子驟降至500米的低空。

sentences.english: General Mills installed the sag correctors at Cedar Rapids.
sentences.chinese: 錫特拉皮茲市的通用磨粉公司就安設了驟降校正器。

sentences.english: They have passed by as ships carrying fruits, as an eagle flying to the prey.
sentences.chinese: 急急駛過，似蘆葦船，如驟降攫食的鷹。

sentences.english: During the days when I don’t do that, my productivity plummets.
sentences.chinese: 我不這樣做的那段日子，我的生產率驟降。

sentences.english: The air temperature will suddenly cut in the near future, the algidity is pressing, a lot of dicast use coal fire heating.
sentences.chinese: 近期氣溫驟降，寒氣逼人，很多市民用煤炭火取暖。

definition: private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
